bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, April 28, 1916

div1.p: Blue directs Carter to proceed to the South in order to investigate the relationship between impounded waters and malaria.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, April 28, 1916
div1.opener:
Please file copy printing
H. R. C
FAD
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
April 28, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital, Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
About May 15 you are hereby directed to proceed to such
places as may be necessary in the states of South Carolina,
Georgia and Alabama, to continue investigations of the in-
fluence of impounded waters on the prevalence of malaria.

On the receipt of instructions from the Bureau, you will
proceed at subsequent dates to places in the states mentioned
and to North Carolina to continue studies of this character.

You are authorized to incur any necessary expenditures
in typewriting your official reports and correspondence, the
work to be done at current rates.

On completion of the duty enjoined you will return to
your station, Baltimore, Md.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue,
Surgeon-General. ans
WEP
Janes
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing in-
structions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
J B
